授業目的: The purpose of the course is to understand financial accounting information which is essential to many forms of communication concerning businesses. Accounting is a language of business. Accounting is the process of identifying, measuring, and communicating economic information to permit informed judgments and decisions. In this course, students learn how accounting information is developed and delivered as well as its strengths and limitations.
到達目標: In this course, students learn the important concepts underlying financial statements, the accounting principles, and some tools to analyze firms' financial reporting. The goal of this course is to equip you with a sufficient understanding of the concepts, methods, and uses of financial information so that you can practically use the financial data of firms and make decisions about economic activities.
特記事項: 本授業科目は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”ではありません。 The course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses.
